results.title: Gas welding
results.brief_description: This film introduces gas welding step by step. The nine sections of the film deal with all stages of welding. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Modern elementary mathematics: equations
results.brief_description: Animation and simple narration are used to explain the concept of equations. Examples are given to help children understand and correctly use equations to express the equality between numbers. Concludes with a number of true and false number sentences. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Sets and numbers
results.brief_description: Uses animation to define the mathematical concept of sets and numbers. Introduces the concepts of order, cardinal number, empty set and equivalent set. Explains that consecutive numbers are just one larger than the preceding numeral.

results.title: Commutativity
results.brief_description: Uses animation, appropriate sound effects and narration to explain the principles of commutativity. Demonstrates that addition is commutative but subtraction is not. Stresses use of commutative property to make learning of addition facts easier.

results.title: My brother Wartovo
results.creator_credit: John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: John Wartovo lives in a small village in Nanuk, near Rabaul, Papua New Guinea. He does not own land there, and being aware of his responsibilities as a father, he applies for land in New Britain. This film deals with events leading up to his departure from his village and explores his doubts and problems. Music by Bruce Smeaton. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Dax
results.creator_credit: Antony Barrier and Mary Glasgow Audio-Visual
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of two teenage girls who arrive for a few days holiday at Dax, a thermal station in the Pyrenees Department of Lands. The narration and conversation are in simple, easy to understand French.

results.title: Fete a Coutances
results.creator_credit: Antony Barrier and Mary Glasgow Audio-Visual
results.brief_description: Describes the life of farmers and villagers in and around Coutances in Normandy. The documentary includes clips of conversations between inhabitants of Coutances, scenes of a wedding and of the 14th July clebrations. In French language.

results.title: Vicki
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Vicki is born without arms and this documentary looks at her approach to life and her ways of coping with work, her future marriage, her desire for children and the way people treat her. One of a series of films originally created for a day-time television discussion panel which was designed to alert the public to the range of social services available from Government and other agencies. Suitable for secondary school level.
